subject: Re: testing void method
msgSnippet: Hi guys, This is officially my first post in one of my favourite groups!  :) ... Well...  the method is also probably doing other interesting things that you
messageBody:
Hi guys,

This is officially my first post in one of my favourite groups! :)

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Jignesh" <jignesh.patel@t...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I have a method which is returning void. How to test it with junit.
>

Well... the method is also probably doing other interesting things
that you /can/ verify (like changing the state of some other object or
some such).

You may want to look into verifying that a particular state change
worked out as per your expectations.

Something else you may want to try is what Martin Fowler refers to as
interaction-based testing (depending on how involved the test is).

(Let me find that link... here it is:
http://martinfowler.com/articles/mocksArentStubs.html)

Here you're not so interested in testing that a certain state has been
updated correctly, but more so that the messages passed between
different objects during an interesting use case have been fired in
the right order.

Read the article, there's a lot more there. It's definitely worth
your time (as is most of his material :)).

Take care,

-
Christian Leskowsky
